title.value: Unveiling the Impact of Arsenic Toxicity on Immune Cells in Atherosclerotic Plaques: Insights from Single-Cell Multi-Omics Profiling
title.justification: This is the official title of the paper as stated in the provided text.
title.quote: Unveiling the Impact of Arsenic Toxicity on Immune Cells in Atherosclerotic Plaques: Insights from Single-Cell Multi-Omics Profiling.

extractions.description: This paper investigates the effects of arsenic exposure on immune cells in atherosclerotic plaques using single-cell multi-omics profiling in apolipoprotein E knockout (apoE-/-) mice. The study reveals how arsenic affects transcriptional and epigenetic changes in immune cells, particularly macrophages, within the plaques.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments and collects data to analyze the impact of arsenic on immune cells in atherosclerotic plaques, making it empirical research.
type.quote: Here, we present one of the first single-cell multi-omics profiling of atherosclerotic plaques in apolipoprotein E knockout (apoE-/-) mice to understand the transcriptomic and epigenetic changes in various immune cells induced by arsenic.

name.justification: The main focus is on the impact of arsenic on immune cells within atherosclerotic plaques, directly linking to cardiovascular diseases.
name.quote: Mounting epidemiological evidence implicates arsenic toxicity as a modifiable risk factor for atherosclerosis, the etiology of the majority of cardiovascular diseases.

name.justification: The study examines the toxic effects of arsenic on immune cells within atherosclerotic plaques.
name.quote: Our study seeks to comprehensively understand how arsenic affects cellular responses and regulatory networks of immune cells within plaques.

name.justification: The research heavily focuses on the immune cell populations and their responses to arsenic exposure within the plaques.
name.quote: Our data reveal that arsenic alters the transcriptional profile of macrophages in a subtype-specific manner with implicated shifts in cell-cell interaction and cell fate predictions.

name.justification: The paper utilizes single-cell multi-omics profiling techniques to study transcriptional and epigenetic changes.
name.quote: To fill this gap, here, we employ 10x genomics multiome sequencing, which simultaneously profiles the transcriptome and epigenome of the cells of arsenic-exposed apoE-/- mice along with respective controls.

name.justification: This model is used to study the effects of arsenic on atherosclerosis in the research.
name.quote: To do so, 5-week-old male apoE-/- mice were fed a high-fat diet and maintained on either tap water or 200 ppb arsenic-containing water for 13 weeks.

is_contributed.justification: The apoE-/- mouse model is a well-established genetic model used in cardiovascular research and not newly contributed by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: In vivo, arsenic-enhanced atherosclerosis is modelled in apolipoprotein E knockout (apoE-/-) mice.

is_executed.justification: Experiments using the apoE-/- mouse model were performed to study the impact of arsenic exposure.
is_executed.quote: In vivo, arsenic-enhanced atherosclerosis is modelled in apolipoprotein E knockout (apoE-/-) mice.

is_compared.justification: This model is not compared to other models; it serves as the primary experimental subject.
is_compared.quote: In vivo, arsenic-enhanced atherosclerosis is modelled in apolipoprotein E knockout (apoE-/-) mice.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference paper is mentioned for the apoE-/- model in this context.

name.justification: This dataset was used in the paper to analyze transcriptional changes in immune cells from atherosclerotic plaques.
name.quote: We undertook the preprocessing of our single-cell RNA-seq data employing the Cell Ranger toolset (v6.1.2).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The single-cell RNA sequencing data was generated and used within this study, not referenced from an external dataset.

name.justification: This dataset was used to examine chromatin accessibility in immune cells from atherosclerotic plaques.
name.quote: To further examine the impact of arsenic on chromatin accessibility, we relabeled the UMAP based on the origin of single cells â€“ plaques from control and arsenic-exposed animals.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The scATAC-Seq data was generated and used within this study, not referenced from an external dataset.

name.justification: Scanpy was used for quality control and analysis of the single-cell data.
name.quote: The Scanpy library (v1.8.2) (33) operating in a Python (v3.7.0) environment was employed for quality control measures in our single-cell data analysis.

referenced_paper_title.value: Explained in 'Wolf, F.A., P. Angerer, and F.J. Theis, SCANPY: large-scale single-cell gene expression data analysis. Genome Biol, 2018. 19(1): p. 15.'
referenced_paper_title.justification: Supporting literature for the Scanpy library is provided in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Wolf, F.A., P. Angerer, and F.J. Theis, SCANPY: large-scale single-cell gene expression data analysis. Genome Biol, 2018. 19(1): p. 15.

name.justification: This technology was used for single-cell multi-omics sequencing.
name.quote: We employed 10x genomics multiome sequencing, which simultaneously profiles the transcriptome and epigenome of the cells of arsenic-exposed apoE-/- mice along with respective controls.

referenced_paper_title.value: Explained in 'Zheng, G.X., et al., Massively parallel digital transcriptional profiling of single cells. Nature communications, 2017. 8: p. 14049.'
referenced_paper_title.justification: Supporting literature for the 10x Genomics Chromium technology is referenced in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Zheng, G.X., et al., Massively parallel digital transcriptional profiling of single cells. Nature communications, 2017. 8: p. 14049.
